questions.q:
In some parts of the world, rainstorms have become more intense over the past several decades.

Is that a change in

or

?

a.label: climate
a.feedback: Sorry! One heavy rainstorm is a weather event—but the trend of more intense rainstorms is a sign of a changing climate.

a.label: weather
a.feedback: Correct! The trend of more intense rainstorms in certain locations is a sign of a changing climate.

questions.q:
Which of these atmospheric gases traps heat as part of the greenhouse effect

or

a.label: methane
a.feedback: Correct! Carbon dioxide is perhaps the most famous greenhouse gas, but methane also traps heat in the atmosphere.

a.label: nitrogen?
a.feedback: Sorry! Nitrogen makes up 80% of Earth’s atmosphere but is not a greenhouse gas.

questions.q: In the U.S., which activity contributes more to carbon dioxide emissions:

a.label: producing electricity & heat
a.feedback: Sorry! Transportation causes more CO2 emissions in the U.S.—but just barely. In 2016, 35% of U.S. CO2 emissions came from the generation of electricity and heat; 36% from transportation.

a.label: or using transportation?
a.feedback: Correct! Transportation causes more CO2 emissions in the U.S.—but just barely. In 2016, 35% of U.S. CO2 emissions came from the generation of electricity and heat; 36% from transportation
